page.title: 04Christ Church,Redhill
page.content: Built in 1844,Christ Church still plays an important part in Redhill life.It is part of Wrington parish but has its own priest-in-charge with a parsonage in the village. This year(1985) the old school bell was dedicated at the harvest thanksgiving and set up in the church porch.The bell had been used for 110 years at Redhill school,which closed in 1984. There is a plaque in the church porch which states that 250 of the 315 seats are declared to be "free and unappropriated for ever".This was because two ecclesiastical societies made grants of Â£80 and Â£90 towards the church building in 1844.
